result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from John Moeller requesting to modify bond to a signature bond from a cash bond, full plans to make all court dates.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:31 AM Defendant John William Moeller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared by video for John William Moeller.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch requests a status in November. Atty Larimore agrees. Court sets status. If Defendant is in custody he can appear remotely, if he is out of custody he needs to appear in person. 11:52
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. DA Hatch & Atty Larimore would like to set an extradition hearing on 22CF125 and have these cases follow. Court adjourned at 1:40 pm.

1:34 PM John William Moeller appears in court, in custody. Atty Joel Kenneth Larimore, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Larimore states this will be a waiver of the PH. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Defendant probably committed a felony. Court binds defendant over for further proceedings.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

8:30 AM Defendant John William Moeller appears in person from Jail, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF162 and 22CF124 (PH). DE would like to wait to do the PH until he has an attorney. Victim appears in Court and Victim's father appears by phone. DE does qualify for PD but one has not been appointed yet. DA Hatch is requesting to set a PH 30 days out. Court adjourned at 8:36 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH L.M. OUTSIDE HIS OFFICIAL CAPACITY.
Def from PCJ

3:04 PM Defendant John William Moeller appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. ADA Walker is requesting a $5,000.00 w/conditions of NC w/L.M and outside his official capacity and no contact with VMMM. Atty Nelson argues. Court orders $2,500.00 w/standard conditions and no contact provision with LM as requested. Prelim demanded. Court adjourned at 3:31 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
